bill.title: Recreational Renaissance Program
bill.description: Fortifies the recreational renaissance program of the department of land and natural resources through various amendments to state law. (SB636 HD2)

history.action: (S) Introduced.
(S) Passed First Reading.
(S) Referred to CPN.
(S) The committee(s) on CPN has scheduled a public hearing on 02-24-09 8:30 AM in conference room 229.

(S) The committee(s) on CPN recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in CPN were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, Ige, Espero, Sakamoto, Hemmings; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Green, Ihara.
(S) Reported from CPN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 470) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1).
(S) 48 Hrs. Notice 03-10-09.
(S) Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
(H) Received from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 215) in amended form (SD 1).
(H) Pass First Reading
(H) Referred to WLO, JUD, referral sheet 28
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by WLO on Monday, 03-16-09 9:00AM in House conference room 325.
(H) The committee(s) recommends that the measure be deferred.
(H) Bill scheduled for decision making on Monday, 03-23-09 9:30AM in conference room 325.

(H) The committees on WLO recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 11 Ayes: Representative(s) Ito, Har, Chang, Coffman, Herkes, C. Lee, Luke, Morita, Sagum, Ching, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Cabanilla, Chong.
(H) Reported from WLO (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1272) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.
(H) Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting no (0) and Chang, Herkes, McKelvey, Pine, Takai, Tokioka excused (6).
(H) Re-referred to WLO, FIN, referral sheet 42
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Monday, 04-06-2009 4:00PM in House conference room 308.

(H) The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 16 Ayes: Representative(s) M. Oshiro, M. Lee, Aquino, Awana, Choy, Har, Keith-Agaran, C. Lee, Nishimoto, Sagum, Tokioka, Yamashita, Pine; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Coffman, Wooley, Ward; 1 Noes: Representative(s) Brower; and Excused: none.
(H) Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1714) as amended in HD 2, recommending passage on Third Reading.
(H) Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 04-14-2009.

(H) Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 2 with Representative(s) Berg, Brower, Choy, Coffman, Hanohano, Nakashima voting no (6) and Representative(s) Carroll, Chang, Mizuno, Morita, Sagum, Takai, Ward excused (7). Transmitted to Senate.
(S) Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 472).
(S) Senate disagrees with House amendments.
(H) Received notice of disagreement (Sen. Com. No. 650).
(H) House conferees appointed: Ito, M. Oshiro Co-Chairs; Har, Yamashita, Thielen.
(S) Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 655).
(S) Senate Conferees appointed: Hee, Chair; Kim, Co-Chair(s); Fukunaga, Kokubun, Hemmings.
(H) Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 756).
(H) Bill scheduled for Conference Committee Meeting on Wednesday, 04-29-09 3:30pm in conference room 224.
(S) Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 05-01-09 10:00 AM in conference room 224.
(S) Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 05-01-09 2:00pm in conference room 224.
(S) Conference committee meeting to reconvene on 05-01-09 4:30PM in conference room 224.
Carried over to 2010 Regular Session.
